content.question:
SELECTED EASTERN EUROPEAN COUNTRIES

Country 
Gross National Incomeper Capita, 1996 
Gross National Incomeper Capita, 2016 

Poland 
$12,600 
$28,770 

Czech Republic 
$19,900 
$32,710 

Slovakia 
$14,100 
$29,910 

Hungary 
$15,700 
$25,640 

Romania 
$10,800 
$22,950 

Sources: Gapminder, Population Reference Bureau

Which of the following best explains why the countries shown in the table experienced increases in economic productivity?

choices.label: Irredentism in former communist states and political divisions among ethnic and religious groups
Dissolving of the Warsaw Pact and economic alliances made with former republics of the Soviet Union
The rise of Russia as an emerging world economy and the economic impacts on its nearby trading partners
Independence following the end of the Cold War and admission to the North American Treaty Organization (NATO)
Self-determination following decline of communism and admission as member states to the European Union

content.answer: Self-determination following decline of communism and admission as member states to the European Union

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain what maps or data imply or illustrate about geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
